thread.title: Jets' goalie shuts down Rangers
thread.title_full: Jets' goalie shuts down Rangers - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Jets' goalie shuts down Rangers
text:
Photo: Kathy Kmonicek Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Winnipeg Jets goalie Michael Hutchinson (34) blocks a shot on goal by New York Rangers left wing Rick Nash (61) during the second period of an NHL hockey game on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Kmonicek) ORG XMIT: MSG106
Photo: Kathy Kmonicek Winnipeg Jets goalie Michael Hutchinson (34) blocks a shot on goal... Jets' goalie shuts down Rangers 1 / 1 Back to Gallery New York
Brian Little scored twice and Michael Hutchinson made 40 saves to lead the Winnipeg Jets to a 4-1 win over the New York Rangers on Tuesday night.
Nikolaj Ehlers and Mark Stuart each added a goal for Winnipeg, which improved to 3-1-0. The victory ended a four-game road trip to begin the season for the Jets.
Despite being outshot 20-8, the Jets went into the second intermission with a 2-1 lead thanks to Little's short-handed goal at 18:49.
His power play goal at 10:35 of the third period sealed the game for the Jets, who handed New York its first loss of the season.
Henrik Lundqvist made 24 saves.
Mats Zuccarello scored New York's lone goal.
The Rangers actually led 1-0 when Zuccarello's third goal of the season opened the scoring 6:45 into the game. The sequence began with Rick Nash harassing Blake Wheeler into an offensive zone turnover. Nash dumped it to Derick Brassard , who quickly found an uncovered Zuccarello.
The advantage lasted for all of 46 seconds.
Ehlers tied the game 1-1 with a power-play goal.
Predators 3, Devils 1: Former Union College goalie Keith Kinkaid stopped 17 shots in his second consecutive start, but New Jersey remained winless in three games for new coach John Hynes and general manager Ray Shero . Devils No. 1 goalie Cory Schneider missed the game for the birth of his son early Tuesday. Pekka Rinne made 22 saves and Nashville ran its season-opening winning streak to three. Rinne, who has allowed only two goals this season, lost his shutout when Kyle Palmieri scored on a power play with 1:40 left. Roman Josi scored in the first on a power play, and Gabriel Bourque and Eric Nystrom added empty-netters in the closing minutes for Nashville.
Canadiens 3, Penguins 2: Tomas Fleischmann scored his first goal of the season early in the third period to lift Montreal past Pittsburgh. Montreal improved to 4-0. Max Pacioretty scored twice for the Canadiens. Carey Price finished with 31 saves for Montreal. Beau Bennett and Kris Letang scored for Pittsburgh, which dropped to 0-3.
Panthers 4, Hurricanes 1: Connor Brickley scored his first NHL goal and Alexsander Barkov gave Florida a two-goal lead 50 seconds later in the third period. Elias Lindholm scored for Carolina in the second period.
Sharks 5, Capitals 0: Martin Jones made 31 saves for his second straight shutout for 3-0-0 San Jose, which has outscored its opponents 12-1 this season. Washington's Alex Ovechkin missed the game for personal reasons.
Red Wings 3, Lightning 1: Henrik Zetterberg had a goal and an assist and Jimmy Howard made 20 saves for 3-0 Detroit. Tampa Bay fell to 3-1.
Stars 4, Oilers 2: Jason Spezza scored three goals, including the tiebreaker late in the third period, and Dallas spoiled Connor McDavid's first NHL goal with a victory over Edmonton.
Blues 4, Flames 3: Colton Parayko scored his first two NHL goals to lead St. Louis.
